alert.note: Alert for Falls; Limestone; Milam; Robertson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 26 at 6:36AM CDT until October 26 at 12:15PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of north central and south central Texas, including the following counties, in north central Texas, Falls and Limestone. In south central Texas, Milam and Robertson. * WHEN...Until 4 PM CDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor-drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall totals of 2-3 inches, with isolated higher amounts up to 5 inches.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
